column5: can anyone help me to use my cuda 242 for ice fishing.will the transducer work if it is placed in the hole.what to use to keep it in the hole.do i have to put the transducer under the ice so it do not interfer with the ice.

Transducers work fine under the ice.  I try to make sure my transducer is sitting right at the bottom edge of the ice for most accurate depth readings.  I tuck all the cable behind the unit except for the amount I need.  Works fine for me.
The further down the hole you place the transducer, the better result you get.  Look at the picture in the link. http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.p...ost&id=9129
As long as the transducer is just under the ice it works great this is my  cuda ice rig  my cuda rig
Mine works fine, and its not down under the ice. Mine is down about a foot. I don't see any reason to have it down past the ice.  I can shoot THRU the ice if I put some water on it.  Sinker
